intro: Kopsia angustipetala, commonly known as narrow-leaved kopsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Kopsia angustipetala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
